<[silence:3400]>
"Endless information. Constant change.
‘Digital age’ describes life shaped by computers, the internet, and instant access to data.<[silence:2400]

It’s like drinking from a firehose—too much, too fast.<[silence:1200]
The challenge isn’t just having information, but sorting it.<[silence:1200]
In 2023, humans created 120 zettabytes of data—enough to fill 120 billion 1TB hard drives.<[silence:2400]
Yet, 60% of emails are spam, and fake news spreads 6x faster than facts.<[silence:1200]
Attention spans shrink—average focus drops from 12 seconds in 2000 to 8 seconds today (less than a goldfish).<[silence:2400]
Privacy? 95% of apps track you.<[silence:1200]
Jobs shift—40% of core skills needed today didn’t exist a decade ago.<[silence:1200]
The digital age demands speed, skepticism, and adaptability—or you drown.<[silence:2400]

Deepfakes. Algorithm bias. Digital burnout.<[silence:1200]>"
